body:
Comment 24 by **czarek.tomczak**: 
@comment #22 dvyu...@google.com

Virtual memory is slow. If my application with its 10 processes reserves 7.36 GB of real
memory (of which oly 5% is used), then it leaves only virtual memory for other
applications, and they will be running like a turtle.

----

I read that Go aims to replace C++. But I don't see this happening on Windows desktop
with these memory features. I think this is even going to be a problem on 64-bit
systems. The 7.36 GB allocation of continous memory is going to be as same big problem
on 64-bit system as 736 MB is on 32-bit.
